Instruction: Make the Crust
Combine dry ingredients: In a medium bowl, whisk together flour and salt.
Cut in butter: Cut in cold butter using a pastry blender or two knives until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Add water: Gradually add ice water, 1 tablespoon at a time, mixing until dough just comes together.
Form dough: Gather dough into a ball, wrap in plastic wrap, and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
Preheat oven to 400°F.
Roll out dough: On a lightly floured surface, roll out dough to a 12-inch diameter circle.
Transfer to pie dish: Fit dough into a 9-inch pie dish, trim edges, and crimp.
Blind bake: Line dough with parchment paper and fill with pie weights. Bake for 15 minutes. Remove weights and parchment, bake for another 5-7 minutes, or until lightly golden.
Make the Lemon Filling
Whisk dry ingredients: In a medium bowl, whisk together sugar and cornstarch.
Combine wet ingredients: In a medium saucepan, whisk together lemon juice, lemon zest, and egg yolks.
Cook filling: Gradually whisk hot water mixture into egg yolk mixture. Return to saucepan over medium heat, cook and stir until thickened, about 8-10 minutes.
Remove from heat: Remove from heat, stir in butter until melted. Strain into a bowl, cover with plastic wrap, and refrigerate until cooled completely.
Make the Meringue
Beat egg whites: In a clean bowl, beat egg whites with cream of tartar until soft peaks form.
Gradually add sugar: Gradually add sugar, beating until stiff peaks form.
Assemble and Bake
Pour filling: Pour lemon filling into cooled pie crust.
Top with meringue: Spread meringue over filling, sealing edges to crust.
Torch meringue (optional): Lightly torch meringue with a kitchen torch to brown lightly.
Bake:** Bake at 350°F for 10-12 minutes, or until meringue is golden brown.

Step: 19. "Cool and serve: Let cool completely before serving."
